title: John Rawls
summary: John Bordley Rawls (/rɔːlz/;[3] February 21, 1921 – November 24, 2002) was an American moral and political philosopher in the liberal tradition.[4][5] Rawls received both the Schock Prize for Logic and Philosophy and the National Humanities Medal in 1999, the latter presented by President Bill Clinton, in recognition of how Rawls's work "revived the disciplines of political and ethical philosophy with his argument that a society in which the most fortunate help the least fortunate is not only a moral society but a logical one".[6]
